intro: Cacalia cinerarioides, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a low-growing habit with silver-gray foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Cacalia cinerarioides is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
